definition: public enemy

public/collectively owned/common/international (e.g. high seas, metric system, calendar)/make public/fair/just/Duke, highest of five orders of nobility 五等爵位[wu3 deng3 jue2 wei4]/honorable (gentlemen)/father-in-law/male (animal)
enemy/to be a match for/to rival/to resist/to withstand
the enemy of the people/the class enemy (Marxism)

sentences.english: I probably would have been public enemy No. 1.
sentences.chinese: 我也許會成爲頭號公敵。

sentences.english: With this just remember the hollywood movie i ROBOT.
sentences.chinese: 看了這個後，一定要記住好萊塢電影《機械公敵》。

sentences.english: They attacked him as "a running dog for the government" and "the enemy of netizens".
sentences.chinese: 他們抨擊他爲“政府的走狗”“網民的公敵”。

sentences.english: "I feel like I am an enemy of the state, " Guo said.
sentences.chinese: 我感覺自己像是一個全民公敵。

definition: to fight openly and maneuver covertly (idiom)
scoundrel/rogue/bully/villain
to angle for fame (idiom)/to fish for compliments
to be drowned (figurative and literal)
fight to the death/desperate struggle
running of armed forces/military management/to govern armed forces/to direct troops
fight a battle of words/cross verbal swords
to suffer defeat in every battle (idiom)
to take a lot of trouble (idiom); painstaking/at the cost of a lot of effort
traitor
to act in collusion (idiom); in cahoots with/villains will look after one another
lit. to return the jade annulus to Zhao (idiom); fig. to return something intact to its rightful owner
scramble for power and profit (idiom); power struggle
inexperienced/junior (employee etc)
outward devotion but inner opposition (idiom); to pay lip service/to agree overtly, but oppose in secret
lit. the salted fish turns over (idiom)/fig. to experience a reversal of fortune
